resources.string: Cannot detect CPU_ABI. If you know, that your device has an ARM or x86 CPU, Debian Kit may run nevertheless.
CPU_ABI %s is supported. Debian Kit should run fine with this.
CPU_ABI %s is (currently) not supported. Debian Kit will not run.
Debian Kit should run fine with %s Gb of RAM.
Your Device only has %s Gb of RAM. You should install via an ADB console, because the Android laucher will be killed during installation.
Your Device only has %s Gb of RAM. Debian Kit will not run with this small amount of RAM.
The kernel supports the %s file system. Debian Kit should run fine with this.

The kernel does not support the ext2, ext3, or ext4 file systems. Without these filesystems, Debian Kit will not run. It may be possible to install/load a kernel module to add the necessary filesystem support.
The kernel supports loop disks. Debian Kit should run fine with this.

The kernel does not support loop disks. Without loop disks, Debian Kit may be installed to an extra partition on an external SD card. It may also be possible to install/load a kernel module to add loop disk support.
Kernel modules are supported. Debian Kit should run fine with this.

Kernel modules are not supported. Debian Kit should run with this, but it is not possible to add drivers to the kernel. If your kernel does not support loop disks or ext file systems, this may be a showstopper.
